abstract.text: An interface an extension implements to convert source media to the output format supported in your extension.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Implement the methods in this interface to run an encoding job, support parallel processing, and send output files to a specified destination. To run an encoding job, the Compressor app calls the
method. During the encoding process, the Compressor app calls the methods in the
protocol to get updates on the status and progress of an encoding job.

Users sometimes request to pause a running encoder task to free up resources. You can choose to support resuming a job where it left off by saving the extension’s state while pausing in the implementation of the

Increase the encoding speed in your extension by taking advantage of distributed processing, where multiple extension instances process segments of source media concurrently. Determine individual segments of the source media to process in extension instances by implementing the
method. To combine the individual encoded segments into a single output file, implement the

abstract.text: Exchange data with Final Cut Pro, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.
An interface an extension implements to convert source media to the output format supported in your extension.
Pauses or cancels an encoding job.
Merges multiple encoded video segments with an encoded audio segment.
Returns the completion percentage of an encoding job.
Returns the percentage of the encoding job lost on pausing.
Encodes the source media files to an output format based on the encoder settings.
Adds annotations to an encoded media file.
Sets chapter markers of an encoded file from the contents of the input dictionary.
Sets the current encoding settings based on the given setting values.
Sets the extension to a previously saved state.
Determines the source media segments based on the number of available encoder services.
Returns the status of an encoding job.
The supported pixel formats in an encoder extension.
The type alias to use for referencing the
